intro: Chaptalia denticellata, commonly known as the toothed chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are typically narrow with serrated edges. Chaptalia denticellata produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It is often found in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to cool, temperate climates.
